The IRS will start issuing $1,400 payments this month.
üìûüíª Georgians with questions should contact our office https://www.ossoff.senate.gov/contact

For tax returns with direct deposit or bank account information, the IRS will be able to send money electronically. For those households for which Treasury cannot determine a bank account, paper checks or debit cards will be sent.

For households that haven‚Äôt yet filed for 2020, the IRS will review records from 2019 to determine eligibility and amount of payment. That includes those who used the ‚Äúnon-filer portal‚Äù for previous rounds of payments.
For individuals and households who have already filed their income tax return for 2020, the IRS will use that information to determine eligibility and size of your payments.

üë®‚Äçüë¶‚Äçüë¶Individuals making up to $75,000 and couples making up to $150,000 will receive a child tax credit.
 
üí∏Families will receive a $3,600 tax credit for each child under 6 and $3,000 for each child between the age of 6 and 16.

üôçüèΩ Individual tax filers making up to $75,000 per year will get $1,400. 

üë©üèæ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèºCouples, who file their taxes jointly, making up to $150,000 will get $2,800. 

üë®‚Äçüë®‚ÄçüëßThere will also be $1,400 tacked on for each dependent in the household.

This last year has been devastating. However news of more vaccines and this new stimulus package have me optimistic for the first time in a while. We‚Äôre not out of the woods yet, but going into this weekend I have a bit more hope. I hope you feel it too.
For more info, here‚Äôs another helpful explainer: https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/10/who-qualifies-for-3000-dollar-child-tax-credit.html
Do I need to sign up? No, the IRS will use your most recent tax return to see if you qualify.
When will I get it? Eligible families will start getting payments as early as July.

Do I qualify? Most families in the Valley will qualify. You get the full child tax credit if you earn $75,000 or less or if as a couple you earn $150,000 or less. From there, the credit decreases as your income increases.

How much will I receive? Most parents in the Valley will get $3,600 for each child under six, and $3,000 for each child aged 6 - 17. You can calculate what you‚Äôll get here: https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2021/child-tax-credit-calculator/?itid=pr_hybrid_experimentrandom_with_top_mostshared_2_na-ans_2
What is a child tax credit? It gives direct payments and/or lowers taxes for eligible parents and caretakers.
First off, what has changed? We made the child tax credit fully refundable, meaning you‚Äôll get the credit no matter how much you owe in taxes. We also increased it by thousands of dollars.

96% of gun background checks are completed within 3 business days. The #CharlestonLoophole bill we passed yesterday would allow the FBI additional time to complete the remaining 4% of background checks to ensure firearms don‚Äôt fall into the wrong hands. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EwTHKwLXMAE2lPO.jpg

I also voted yes on H.R. 1446, which closes the #CharlestonLoophole.

This loophole allows someone to purchase a firearm 3 days after a background check begins, even if it hasn‚Äôt been completed -- putting guns into the hands of people already prohibited by law from owning them. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EwTGU5vXAAokn47.jpg

Background checks work. Since they were first implemented in 1994, they have stopped guns from falling into the hands of 3 million+ people prohibited by law from owning a firearm.

Every day, background checks stop over 50 domestic abusers & nearly 20 fugitives from buying a gun. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EwTHUJLWgAQrb99.jpg
Universal background checks are supported by well over 90% of the American people ‚Äì including 90% of gun-owning households, as well as dozens of leading law enforcement and veterans organizations.
Yesterday the House passed H.R. 8, which requires a background check for every gun sale or transfer http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EwTETSqWgAc0Jch.jpg

Universal savings accounts (USAs) rebalance tax policy so that saving is on equal footing with spending. Unlike traditional tax-neutral savings vehicles, USAs allow saving for all goals, not just government-approved ones.
How are family relationships faring in America during this trying time? The share of Americans in a relationship is lower than in the previous five years. But there are some positive signs too ‚¨áÔ∏è

Universal Savings Accounts would help families pursue their own savings goals throughout life, and they would finance the creation and deepening of valuable relationships and institutions throughout American society.
